quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Atlanta and Netherlands
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, margate, atlanta. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What product was invented at Jacobs Pharmacy in Atlanta in 1886?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coca Cola

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a former name for Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orchard Hill

questions.question: What tragic event occurred in Atlanta on December 7, 1946?

options.text: A mid-air collision of two planes during an air show

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Winecoff Hotel Fire

questions.question: Who ascended to the Dutch throne in 1980?
Who was the first African American mayor of Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maynard Jackson

questions.question: How did Margaret Mitchell die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hit by a taxi

questions.question: In addition to hosting the Centennial Olympic Games in 1996, what other significant sporting event was held in Atlanta in the same year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World Series

questions.question: Lucy, the wooden gigantic elephant, can be seen in Margate, New Jersey.

In 1864, General Serman made his way through Georgia on his way to Atlanta leaving a path of destruction which accumulated with the Battle of Atlanta in July. Just before the Battle of Atlanta, General Joe Johnston had been replaced by another general who led the Confederate troops during the rest of the Campaign of Atlanta. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Bell Hood

questions.question: The flag of the Netherlands consist of three 3 equal horizontal bands of red, white, and blue.
The Netherlands has a land border only with Belgium.
This place in the Netherlands, known as the Garden of Europe, is famous for a large permanent display of tulips.

On December 15, 1939 all eyes were on Atlanta as Clark Gable, Vivian Lee and many other Hollywood stars came out for the long-awaited premeir of Gone With the Wind. At what theater did the movie make its world debut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lowes Grand Theater

questions.question: What is the largest city of South Holland, one of the Netherlands provinces?
Which of the following painters is Dutch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Trees and Gravity
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, englands, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is a floating wedding chapel in St. Petersburg, Florida.
Rachel, Nevada lies on Highway 375, known as the Extraterrestrial Highway.
What year was the Sydney Harbor Bridge opened?
Carhenge is a replica of Englands Stonehenge located in Nebraska.
Port Arthur is a former convict settlement, located on what Australian peninsula?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tasman Peninsula

questions.question: On Nantucket Island there are oaks trees famous for the magical creatures carved in them.
Bishop Castle is a massive stone castle hand built by Jim Bishop.
The Great Barrier Reef is composed of over 2,900 individual reefs.
Which of the following famous Australian structures was formally opened on October 20, 1973 by Queen Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sydney Opera House

questions.question: A 134-feet high thermometer is located in Mojave Desert.
A large twine ball can be seen in Kansas.
Name the large sandstone formation in the southern part of the Northern Territory, in central Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uluru (Ayers Rock)

questions.question: The Desert of Maine is located beside a stretch of green pine trees and flowing streams.
In Gravity Hill, Bedford County, Pennsylvania objects such as cars left on neutral appear to be rolling uphill against the force of gravity.
The Royal Botanic Gardens are located near the center of downtown Sidney.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Legend
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, egypt, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Тhe Valley of the Kings is located in Egypt.
Zanzibar is part of the Republic of Tanzania.
What statement is true about Shambala?

options.text: It is seen as a Buddhist Pure Land.
In Tibetan tradition, it is a mythical kingdom hidden in Inner Asia.
According the legends it is located somewhere in the Himalayas.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what country is the greeting wai, (slight bow, with the palms pressed together) used to welcome, thank , apologize, or say goodbye?
Castle Hill is a pink granite rock in Queensland, Australia.
Camelot is a fortress-city associated with the legend of King Arthur.
The legendary island Avalon was known as the isle of cherries.
According to legend, in what present day country was El Dorado, the lost city of gold, located?
What explorer named Kangaroo Island in South Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matthew Flinders

questions.question: Interesting attractions in the Australian town of Coober Pedy include which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these was the capital of the Mongol Empire during the 13th century?
Atlantis is a legendary island, first mentioned by Plato.
Troy, the focus of the Trojan War described in the Iliad, is located in present day Greece.
The Bungle Bungle, a major component of the Purnululu National Park in Western Australia, is what kind of attraction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sandstone formations

questions.question: Timbuktu is a town in Zimbabwe.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: State and Greeting
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, kowtow, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What traditional greeting is used by the Maori, the indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand?
In what country did the greeting gesture Anjali Mudra originate?
Which of these is a variation of the popular fist pound greeting, similar in meaning to a handshake, high five or nose rub?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air knucks

questions.question: Which U.S. state has chosen the Northern Cardinal for its official state bird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What does the greeting Kowtow used traditionally in China consist of?

options.text: Touching of the palms of the two people
Taking off ones hat and pressing it to the stomach while bowing
Kneeling and bowing so low that the head is touching the ground
Clapping ones hands twice and then touching the shoulders

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kneeling and bowing so low that the head is touching the ground

questions.question: The phrase gimme some skin, a version of the gimme five salute, is thought to have originated in this New York City neighborhood.
Purple Passionflower is the official state wildflower of this U.S. state.
What is the religious meaning of the Namaste, a popular spoken greeting used in South Asia?

options.text: I bow to that inherent in you.
I respect divinity within you that is also within me.
The light within me honors the light within you.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Blue crabs are the official state food of this U.S. state.
What Arabic word is for Muslim babies, and is also the name of a gesture used to greet people?
The Appalachian Dulcimer is the official state musical instrument of this U.S. state.
What type of greeting gesture is the so-called Eskimo Kiss?

options.text: A kiss on the tip of the nose

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two people rubbing noses together

questions.question: What is the official state beverage of the U.S. state of Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cranberry juice

questions.question: What is the official state color of the U.S. state of South Carolina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indigo Blue

questions.question: What salute originated from a painting by Jacques-Louis David, as the gesture had never been described or depicted in ancient works of art?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman salute

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Australia and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, argyle, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the longitudinal extent of Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 114 - 154 degree east

questions.question: Ashtabula is the county seat of Ashtabula County.
Which is the largest body of freshwater in Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Argyle

questions.question: What does Ashtabula mean in the Iroquois language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River of many fish

questions.question: What is the official state sport of the U.S. state of Alaska?
The original inhabitants of Australia are the Aborigines.
The Uluru (or also Ayers Rock) rock formation in Australia is sacred to the Indigenous Aborigines.
What is the latitudinal extent of Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10 - 40 degree south

questions.question: The American Holly is the official state tree of this U.S. state.
What is the official state toy of the U.S. state of Mississippi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy bear

questions.question: Lake Eyre in Australia is among the largest areas of inland drainage in the world.
Who is the author of the poem Crossing Ohio When Poppies Bloom in Ashtabula?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Sandberg

questions.question: The United States Census Bureau defined the Ashtabula area as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Micropolitan Statistical Area

questions.question: The lowest point of Australia is Lake Argyle.
What is the official state mammal of the U.S. state of Alabama?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Pentagon and Ashtabula
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Pentagon is the worlds largest office building by floor area.
Approximately how many people work in The Pentagon?
Construction of The Pentagon building began on September 11th, 1941.
Ashtabula is home to a large number of people of Finnish, Italian, and Swedish descent.
Which European city is a sister city of Ashtabula?

options.text: Chernobyl, Ukraine until the nuclear meltdown of 1986

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bardejov, Slovakia

questions.question: As of 2008, Robert Gates was the Secretary of Defense.
The Pentagon has 6 zip codes dedicated to it.
Which of the following is a NFL running back born in Ashtabula, Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jarrod R. Bunch

questions.question: What building served as the Department of War headquarters before the Pentagon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Munitions Building

questions.question: The Pentagon is controlled by the Secretary of Defense. Who was the first one to hold that position in 1947?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Forrestal

questions.question: This collectible candy has a museum located in Easton, PA.
The Pentagon was completely destroyed during the September 11th attacks in 2001.
Which of the following is referred to as the Ashtabula Horror?

options.text: the worst civilian radioactive release in U.S. history
one of the bloodiest riots in U.S. history
a sinkhole that swallowed half of the Historic Harbor District
a train disaster that occurred in 1876

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a train disaster that occurred in 1876

questions.question: The Pentagon is located in what American city?
Was Ashtabula an important stop on the Underground railroad, used to convey African-American slaves to Canada?
